Innovative education services

Innovative Education Services conducts its educational activities for the academic program "Multimedia Technology", which is the part of the Visual Arts Lab.

The primary mission of Innovative Education Services is to provide highly qualitative educational programs for innovative ways of studying.

The teaching staff

  • Мультимедийные технологии

Профессорско-преподавательский состав состоит из приглашенных иностранных преподавателей из более чем 10 различных стран на 3 континентах, которые представляют собой как передовых ученых, так и практиков с многолетним опытом работы в отрасли.

  • Multimedia Technology

    Manjeet Singh

    MVA, Delhi University, India

    Master degree holder in Visual Arts with a Bachelor degree in Fine Arts from College of Fine Arts, New Delhi- India, with sound professional experience in digital film production, computer animation & gaming industry. A total work experience of 12 years as a 3D Specialist with some of the leading digital animation companies and multimedia institutions in India. Spearheading the dream project SAA (School of Art & Animation) founded in 2008 as its Founder & Chief Executive Officer.

  • Aroop Kerketta

    MSc in Multimedia Technologies, India.

    Worked as a Creative Head for Trident Exhibitions Pvt. Ltd. Created  design solutions for companies like Samsung, Qatar Airways, Fuji Films, Videocon, Indian Oil, ONGC, Bharat Petroleum, Bajaj Luminaries, to name a few, also worked as a 3D modeller at 3D Solutions, New Delhi. Presently working as a Lecturer for  3D and VFX in the Dept. of Animation and multimedia, Birla Institute of Technology, India.

  • Vanja Garaj

    Brunel University

    Dr. Vanja Garaj, the Lecturer in Creative Multimedia Design, School of Engineering and Design, Electronic and Computer Engineering Department of Brunel University, United Kingdom. Vanja Garaj is PhD in Systems Design (Human Factors). He has the extensive professional experience in the field of Multimedia Technology and Computer Graphics, and he is the coordinator of the program in the field of Digital Media / Creative Multimedia Design. During his visit, Professor Vanja Garaj taught two-weeks module "Graphic and Web Designing" for “Multimedia Technologies” master students.

  • Petyo Budakov

    New Bulgarian University, Bulgaria

    Petyo Budakov is an assistant-professor of New Bulgarian University, Director of the International Center for Online Education Fine Arts in Sofia, Bulgaria. Petyo Budakov is a PhD in 3D Graphic Design (New Bulgarian University). He has professional experience in the field of multimedia technology and computer graphics. He is a Managing Director of Budakov Films Ltd. During his visit Professor Petyo Budakov has taught the module "2D to 3D conversion" for Multimedia Technologies master students.

  • Richard James Glassey

    Robert Gordon University, Scotland, Great Britain

    Professor of School of Computing Science and Digital Media, Robert Gordon University (UK) Richard James Glassey. Richard Glassey is a Ph.D. in Computer Science (University of Strathclyde). He has a professional experience in the field of multimedia technology and computer graphics, and he is a Fellow of the Higher Education academy (UK). During his visit Dr. Richard Glassey will conduct modular course "Advanced Programming in Web Development" for Multimedia Technologies master students. He has more than 10 research publications in the field of Information Technologies.
